Use search_document_regex across all documents for pattern like "duration of decree" or "decree will last" or "will last for" or "for a period of". Let's search regex across all.<|end|><|start|>assistant<|channel|>commentary to=functions.search_document_regex <|constrain|>json<|message|>{
  "doc_name": "all",
  "pattern": "(?i)decree.*?will\\s+(last|remain|effective).*?(for|during|up to|until|through|to)\\s+([\\w\\s–]+[\\w\\s])",
  "flags": ["IGNORECASE", "DOTALL"],
  "top_k": 10,
  "context_tokens": 200
}

Thus the final action: update_checklist with patch for key "How_Long_Decrees_will_Last" with extracted entry: value "Not Applicable" and evidence: text "The Court finds ... injunctive relief" etc. Let's construct the snippet: "The Court finds that ... injunctive relief is sought ... The Court joins other district courts ... The Court ... injunctive relief for the Federation’s members." That snippet includes injunctive relief. We'll include that as evidence.               "text": "The Court finds that Plaintiffs have provided declarations and other submissions discussing harms experienced by a representative sample of member Councils. See generally ECF 9, 10, 14, 15, 16, 17, 18, 36-1.34 Additionally, although the specific number of terminated grants may vary from Council to Council, the Federation’s claims in this case depend not on evidence that differs from Council to Council, but whether Defendants’ decision to mass terminate grant funding to the Federal/State Partnership violates federal law and constitutional principles. Accordingly, the Court joins other district courts around the country that have concluded in similar contexts that associations have standing to bring cases on behalf of their members. In other words, what Plaintiffs request is not a universal injunction. They do not request an injunction applying to “any person” or against Defendants writ large. Plaintiffs’ request for relief properly is limited to themselves, and for the Federation, within the relief afforded by direct and associational standing.",

            }
          ]
        }
      ]
    }
  ]
}

evidence.text: The Court finds that Plaintiffs have provided declarations and other submissions discussing harms experienced by a representative sample of member Councils. See generally ECF 9, 10, 14, 15, 16, 17, 18, 36-1.34 Additionally, although the specific number of terminated grants may vary from Council to Council, the Federation’s claims in this case depend not on evidence that differs from Council to Council, but whether Defendants’ decision to mass terminate grant funding to the Federal/State Partnership violates federal law and constitutional principles. Accordingly, the Court joins other district courts around the country that have concluded in similar contexts that associations have standing to bring cases on behalf of their members. In other words, what Plaintiffs request is not a universal injunction. They do not request an injunction applying to “any person” or against Defendants writ large. Plaintiffs’ request for relief properly is limited to themselves, and for the Federation, within the relief afforded by direct and associational standing.
